intro: Pycnocoma macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved pycnocoma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy composite flowers. The plant is notable for its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
